newsitem.title: UK: EMU can start on time - Lamfalussy.
newsitem.headline: EMU can start on time - Lamfalussy.

text.p: Alexandre Lamfalussy, outgoing head of the European Monetary Institute, is confident that European Monetary Union can start on time in 1999.

"The reason I have changed my mind since the start of 1996 (when he mentioned the possibility of an orderly technical delay) is the very strong progress on price stability," he told the Financial Times.
"This includes countries about which I had doubts. I had no doubt that Spain was on track. But I had no idea Spain was going on that track so fast.
"The same applies to Greece, where the inflation rate has gone down from over 10 percent to six percent."
Lamfalussy said he was also impressed by "the political determination demonstrated by fiscal policy, the political will to try to tackle problems."
